pageTitle: Patente US4637393 - Surgical instrument - Google Patentes
textBeforeTable: Citas de patentes Many modifications can be made to the invention without departing from the spirit and scope of the invention as defined in the appended claims. Without prejudice to the generality of the term "member", the latter is intended to include within its scope a surgical tool such as a surgical knife, cutter, blade, drill or the like. It will however be appreciated that, whilst the invention has been specifically described in the context of surgery, the scope of the inventon is not limited to such application, since it can find application also in any operation on any organ or body part into which a tool or other member (e.g. a probe) is to be inserted, or in which a "blind" hole or incision is to be made to an accurately predetermined depth related to a face of the organ or body part remote from the member. The device illustrated is particularly suitable for ophthalmic surgery, such as for example radial keratotomy procedures, where initially the knife 1 is retracted so as not to protrude from the knife guard 10, and the latter is positioned on the cornea of the eye which is to be incised to the required depth as aforesaid. In use, the device is energised by an electrical power supply (not shown). The means responsive to the said comparison signal provided by the servo-amplifier 21 are in the form of a servo-motor and thread
